generated.html:
About
Who We Are
Detester Magazine, founded in 2019, is a space and platform dedicated to inspiring BIPOC youth activism and amplifying socio-political issues. We truly believe that art and writing are powerful mediums for change. We want to amplify all issues that affect BIPOC communities, whether it concerns politics, society, culture, mental health, environment, etc. We aim to push past the endless single stories to deliver a picture that expresses distilled human emotions and diverse perspectives. We are BIPOC youth-led and for BIPOC youth. One of our fundamental pillar is artivism: the intersection between art and activism.
Our Mission
1. Amplify socio-political issues that affect minorities
2. Empower creative BIPOC youth to raise their voices on issues that matter to them
3. Inspire creative BIPOC youth to be socially and politically active
Meet Our Team

Huiwen Chen
Founder & Executive Director

Huiwen is 17 and a junior at BHSEC in NYC. She is passionate about the intersection of art and activism and founded the organization to inspire other minority youth to be more socially and politically engaged. She also works for art and education equity non-profits. In her spare time, you can find her drawing, painting, and learning how to code.

Anju Meyer
Co-founder & Editor-In-Chief

Anju is 17 and a junior at Bard High School Early College Manhattan. She is passionate about social and environmental justice. In her free time, she enjoys reading and doing robotics.

Theo Brandt
Co-Founder & Art Director

Theo Brandt is a junior at Bard High School Early College, Manhattan. He produces research-based art and writing for the magazine. Artistically, he is passionate about pushing conceptual boundaries, which he believes is central to Detester's mission. His hobbies and interests include philosophy and thrift shopping.

Karen Choi
Design Director

Karen Choi is a 16-year-old current junior at SITHS in NYC. She is passionate about advocating for women’s equality, ocean awareness, and the environment. She hopes that this project will bring light to these topics in hope for change. She spends her free time painting, drawing, and designing. She is also currently an architecture intern and hopes to pursue that in the future

Pooja Rayapaneni
Public Relations Co-Director

Pooja is a sophomore at Bergen County Academies in New Jersey. She hopes to bring light of socio-political issues such as immigration, gender inequality, and to speak out against racial gaslighting and micro-agressions. In addition, she plays lacrosse and loves to create art and binge on Netflix in her free time.

Afifa Zahid
Public Relations Co-Director

Afifa is a current high school junior at Bard manhattan and lives in NYC. She wants to be a part of something that focuses on amplifying youth voices. It’s very easy to get a pessimistic outlook on the future but we have to remember that one day we will be able to vote and make a real change. She believes that we have to get educated now. She finds it simply inspiring to be surrounded by the passionate young people that make up our staff team. Aside from the magazine, she enjoys playing saxophone. She’s played it for almost 5 years and hopes to continue it in the future!

Dorothy Chan
Project Director

Dorothy is a rising junior at Brooklyn Technical High School in NYC. She is passionate about raising awareness on the environment and societal inequalities. You can find her baking or spending time with her friends.

Anshika Nangia
Website Co-Director

Anshika is a 16-year-old highschooler from South Brunswick, NJ. She loves the mission to stand for youth activism and looks forward to spreading awareness about important political issues to the youth. She spends her free time watching netflix, dancing, singing, performing, spending time with friends and family or reading.

Crystal Liang
Website Co-Director

Crystal is a rising senior at a New York City High School. She is an advocate for sustainability, fighting against world hunger, and the innovation of technology to improve people's quality of life. In her free time shes likes to code websites, play virtual escape room games, and binge watch Tiny House videos.

Mahi Jain
Graphic Designer

Mahi is a Plant Sciences undergrad from University of Delhi, India. She is a passionate advocate for promoting the rights of women and youth. In her free time she can be seen reading, painting or learning Greek and Latin.

Amy Zheng
Graphic Designer

Yang Jing (17 years old) is a rising senior at Bloor Collegiate Institute located in Toronto, Ontario. Also called Amy, she is passionate about experimenting with new designs and making videos. Often, you may find her spending hours watching Youtube and editing videos. Other times, she enjoys baking and trying new recipes.

Kristy Lee
Graphic Designer

Kristy is 17 and attends SITHS. She lives in Brooklyn, NYC. She is passionate about climate change and the Black Lives Matter movement. In her free time, she loves to draw, read, and longboard.

Jenny Nguyen
Graphic Designer

Jenny is a rising senior at Albert Einstein High School in Maryland. She is passionate about bridging the gender gap in the STEM field, bringing awareness to environmental injustice and social justice issues.She enjoys working out, playing video games, creating video montages, and baking in her free time.

Mary Balderas
Graphic Designer

Mary Angelic Balderas, A 19-year-old and senior high school graduate of multimedia arts at Iacademy. Currently studying the college course of Multimedia Arts at De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde, School of Design and Arts. She resides at Antipolo City in the country of the Philippines. She is eager to enlighten and make others aware of the matters that are happening around the globe through the use of art and illustration. Mary is a young ambitious and passionately driven gal who learns at her own pace. After she has done her time after class, she likes to take the time on doing freelance and creating more craft. Other than that, She likes to play badminton and do tons of cycling!

Olivia Wu
Graphic Designer

Olivia is 16 and a rising high school senior from New York City. Disturbed by contemporary society's flaws, she grows passionate about minimizing the gap in ethnic privilege and helping to create a proper standard for human equality. In her free time, Olivia can be found drawing, practicing calligraphy, editing videos, and playing video games! Some of her aspirations include pursuing the STEM field and confronting socio-political issues in order to enact change.

Suzanna Chen
Writer

Suzanna is a seventeen-year-old, grade eleven student from Vancouver, Canada. She enjoys producing literary and artistic works for a cause she is passionate about - spreading awareness and shattering the stigma around mental health conditions. Some of her hobbies include music - both performing and arranging, visual arts - mostly landscape sketches and photography, and writing of all literary genres.

Newton Brophy
Writer

Newton "Salem" Brophy is a 25-year-old Rhode Islander living in the Tampa Bay area. Sé is particularly passionate about gender, mental health, spirituality, religion, labor rights, and freedom from policing both domestically and overseas. Newton's hobbies include playing with power tools, pondering kitty cats, and winning staring contests with men in public restrooms.

Lillian Hinojosa
Writer

Lillian is a 15 year old rising junior in highschool who lives in Los Angeles, CA.She is extremely passionate about breaking the stigma around mental illnesses and disorders, as well as raising awareness for social injustices that she feels deserves an elevated platform in the media.In her free time, Lillian loves to paint, volunteer, play soccer, and ultimately try to inspire the people around her.

Eliet Williamson-Diaz
Editor

Eliet is a 16 year old rising Year 2 from NYC who attends Bard High School Early College.She is passionate about animals, the environment, LGBTQ+ rights, and creating safe spaces for young girls in the gymnastics community. She spends her free time experimenting with vegan recipes, coaching gymnastics, hanging with her dogs, and trying her best to educate herself about current events!

Ainhoa Merchan
Artist

Ainhoa Merchan, 16 years old, attends AITE. She is a rising junior who lives in Norwalk, CT. She is very passionate about many subjects, mainly the those revolving around political issues that harm minorities. She is a big proponent of equality, whether that’s natural equality (ex: gender equality), social equality, or civil equality. She also enjoys spreading awareness about world issues such as climatic issues. She mainly spends her free time learning, drawing, or reading. She also dabbles in baking as well as trying new forms of exercise.

Harvi Karatha
Editor

Harvi is a 16-year-old, grade 12 student from Oakville, Ontario. She is passionate about issues like abortion rights, workplace discrimination, combating homelessness, and political accountability. She spends her free time being angry about discrimination around the world and the mistreatment of people. She is a bharatanatyam dancer and is president of CEDO Foundation.

Anna Kwan
Editor

Anna is a junior from Irvine. She is passionate about journalism and art. In her free time, she enjoys drawing, Taekwondo, and baking.

Madhumita Raman
Editor

Madhumita is a 17 year old rising senior at Eastlake High School, based in Sammamish, Washington. She is passionate about the Model Minority myth and how that has been used to enforce the systematic oppression of the African American community and how the Asian community can use its privilege to tackle the problem at its root. In her free time, she likes to read, dance, paint, and play video games.

Amber Campbell
Editor

Amber is a rising senior from Illinois. She is passionate about using her voice and platforms to highlight the injustices and inequalities present in the world today. In her free time, you can find Amber listening to podcasts, trying healthy vegan recipes, or reading a book-especially one from the Ender’s Game Series.

Anne Mai
Writer

Anne Mai is a rising junior attending Midwood High school in Brooklyn, New York. She is passionate about advocating for environmental justice, human rights, and equality for minorities. In her free time, Anne likes to spend time with her friends and try new foods across the city.

Chantal Kapani
Writer

Chantal is a university student from the South of England who spends her time in Northern England for her studies. She is a writer who tries to explore every aspect of writing as much as she can, ranging from poetry to opinionated articles. she is passionate about literature that can bring a change to the world and push boundaries to do so. She can either be found in the coffee shop work ing with her university friends and filling her coffee addiction. If not, she can be found coming up with ideas for her blog.

Praguni Kumar
Writer

Praguni is a 15 y/o rising sophomore from India.She’s passionate about youth and BIPOC activism and stands for human rights.She is mostly researching current topics and writing on them or discussing socio-political issues in her community

Jamie Zou
Writer

Jamie is a Bay Area native and a rising sophomore at a boarding high school on the East Coast. She enjoys sharing about issues that are important to her— educating others and constantly learning from them too. When she’s not writing articles, you can find her drawing or watching movies.

Lindsay Wong
Writer

Lindsay is a third-year Bachelor of Arts student at the University of Melbourne, where she currently resides, double majoring in history and Asian studies. She is passionate about elevating marginalized voices. In her free time, she loves to drink bubble tea, watch films from around the world and critique them, and indulge in anime, K-drama and K-pop.

Malya Robenson
Writer

Malya is 17 years old and attends LaGuardia High School in New York City. She is very interested in climate change and LGBTQ+ issues. In her free time, she enjoys reading, watching cartoons, and other indoor activities.

Odessa Zhang
Project Manager

Odessa Zhang is a rising sophomore at McLean High School locates in McLean, Virginia.She is incredibly passionate about uplifting the voices of minorities, as a minority herself; Odessa is incredibly involved with activism. Outside of Detester Magazine, Odessa loves to go on hikes and also spends her free time baking!

Vasco Vidal
Project Manager

Vasco is a 16-year-old rising junior at Indiana University High School. He is passionate about social and political issues. He wants to educate others about racism, LGBTQ+ rights, environmental justice, feminism, and immigration. In his free time, he reads, draws, writes, and learns saxophone.

Margaret Lee
Outreach Manager

Margaret is a 17 year old junior at Bard High School Early College from Brooklyn, New York. Margaret is passionate about social and political issues and loves to push the world around her to change for the better.She is interested in photography, dabbles in modeling, and there is nothing else in the world she loves more than spending time with her friends.

Nandita Raman
Social Media Manager

Nandita Raman is a 17 year old rising senior at Eastlake High School in Sammamish, WA. She is passionate about spreading awareness on social justice topics and educating herself and others.She loves to dance, listen to music, and participates in clubs such as DECA and AID (Association for India's Development)

Shifeng Zie
Social Media Manager

Shifeng Xie is a 15-year-old rising sophomore at SITHS in NYC. He is passionate about giving everyone in the world an equal opportunity at a good education and amplifying the voices of oppressed or silenced groups. In his free time, he loves running, hanging out with friends, and playing video games.

Risha Alvi
Outreach Manager

Risha is a first year university student from Mississauga, Ontario (Canada).At 17 years old, she’s accomplished a lot by being member & leader for various youth community groups and non-profit organizations. She has always taken initiative to create and advocate for change in a positive manner. She is hoping to have a career in Law & International Public Policy in the future. In her free time, you can usually catch her reading, watching Netflix or Disney, listening to music or hanging out with her friends. She has a huge passion for art, literature, music and sports.

Roxanne Fernandes
Social Media Manager

Roxanne (yes like the song, she doesn’t want to talk about it😤) is a rising sophomore living in Princeton, New Jersey. She is passionate about advocating for human rights and wants to be a part of something that would encourage her generation to be more socially active and caring towards minorities and the injustices they face in society. She thinks it is very important that we start educating ourselves now. Over quarantine she has been baking, painting, and sewing masks for first responders. In her free time she also enjoys listening to music, shopping, watching shows/movies, and hanging out with her friends.

Vashed Thompson
Social Media Manager

Vashed is a rising junior from austin, texas. She is passionate about gender equality, human rights, and the fight against racism. She plays volleyball, enjoys longboarding, and loves music.

Asma Husein
Social Media Manager

Asma is a rising junior from the UK. She hopes to shed light on issues that we need to spread awareness about. She also enjoys playing badminton and photography.

Julie Zhou
Web Developer

Julie is a college senior, 21, and lives in Yorktown, VA. She is passionate about the arts, computer science, issues around identity, social justice, and activism. She likes to spend her time drawing, reading, watching dramas, or playing tennis.

Rasmit Devkota
Web Developer

Rasmit Devkota is a sophomore at South Forsyth High School in Cumming, Georgia.Rasmit takes great interest in learning about overlooked and misrepresented cultures through his study of languages.Rasmit spends a great deal of his time growing his own startups. In his free time, he often watches dramas, studies different things, and writes websites and programs.
